title: Define project scope and requirements
description: Gather and document the requirements for the LocalExperienceMatchmaker platform, including user stories, functional and non-functional requirements, and any constraints or assumptions.

title: Design System Architecture for Local Experience Matchmaker
description: Design the overall system architecture for the Local Experience Matchmaker project. The design should focus on maintainability, modularity, scalability, and performance, taking into account aspects such as user authentication and authorization, search and matching algorithms (including AI/ML integration with collaboration from our data science team), payment processing, messaging and communication, rating and review systems, scalability and load balancing, error handling and graceful degradation for edge cases, data privacy and security, and documentation of components, dataflow, and interactions between different modules. This RFC serves as a guide for the development team. Once the project scope and requirements have been defined, this task can be assigned to the code-architect or task-decomposer based on the project's needs. This RFC is now ready for the 'IN_PROGRESS' state (as it requires feedback from the team before moving forward). Please note that the AI/ML integration in search and matching algorithms may require ongoing collaboration with our data science team. The following suggestions are made: 1. Clarify the specific requirements of user authentication and authorization, including details on how different roles (e.g., traveler, local experience provider, guide) will be handled. Specify clear permissions for each role. 2. Specify more concrete expectations for the AI/ML component, such as which algorithms to use, data sources required, and expected outcomes. Provide a brief overview of the collaboration process with the data science team. 3. Include a timeline or estimated timeline for each major deliverable of the project, including milestones and deadlines. 4. Consider adding requirements for monitoring system performance and implementing A/B testing for continuous improvement. 5. Address potential issues related to cross-platform compatibility and mobile optimization. 6. Define the technology stack that will be used for the development of this project. This RFC is now ready for the 'IN_PROGRESS' state, assigned to 'code-architect'.

title: Design database schema for LocalExperienceMatchmaker
description:
The current task description is comprehensive and covers all necessary aspects. However, to further clarify the scope and expectations, it would be beneficial to specify the following: 

1. Define the data structure for each entity (user profiles, experiences, guides, etc.) with examples. 
2. Detail how the normalization, indexing, partitioning, caching, and performance optimizations will be implemented.
3. Specify the exact cloud-based databases to be used (e.g., AWS DynamoDB or Google Firestore).
4. Explain the strategy for sharding based on geographical regions.
5. Describe the security measures in more detail, including encryption at rest, access control, and data masking strategies.
6. Discuss the implementation of server-side caching and materialized views.
7. Provide an overview of the monitoring system to be used for tracking database usage patterns and identifying potential bottlenecks.

In addition, since the task is ready for further review and discussion, update the 'rfc_state' field: 
'rfc_state': 'READY_FOR_DISCUSSION'

title: Develop user authentication and authorization
description: Implement user authentication and authorization mechanisms, including user registration, login, and role-based access control.

title: Develop user profile management
description: Implement functionality for users to create and manage their profiles, including personal information, interests, and preferences.

title: Develop experience and guide management
description: Implement functionality for creating, updating, and managing local experiences and guides, including descriptions, pricing, availability, and ratings.

title: Implement matchmaking algorithm
description: Develop the algorithm to match travelers with local experiences and guides based on shared interests, personality traits, and cultural preferences.

title: Design and develop user interface
description: Design and implement the user interface for the LocalExperienceMatchmaker platform, including user profiles, experience browsing, booking, and messaging.

title: Implement payment processing
description: Integrate a secure payment gateway to handle transactions between travelers and guides.

title: Set up continuous integration and deployment
description: Establish a continuous integration and deployment pipeline for automated testing, building, and deploying the application.

title: Implement security measures
description: Implement security measures to protect user data and ensure the platform's integrity, including encryption, secure communication, and input validation.

title: Conduct testing and quality assurance
description: Develop and execute test plans for functional, non-functional, and security testing to ensure the platform meets the requirements and is ready for production.

title: Write documentation
description: Create comprehensive documentation for users, administrators, and developers, including user guides, technical documentation, and API references.
